title: How to Make Your Hoodie iPod Capable

steps.headline: Gather your hoodie and sewing supplies.
Cut a tiny hole in the top of the pocket.
Using a needle and thread, secure the edges of the hole with a few stitches.
Turn the hoodie right side out.
Stitch a small strip of Velcro to either side of the edge of the inner pocket.
steps.description: This will keep the iPod from falling out of your pocket.

steps.headline: Place the iPod in the pocket.
Slide the wire through the hole, from the inside of your jacket.
steps.description: Plug the wire into the iPod. The headphones should be on the inside of the jacket.

steps.headline: Put the jacket on and place the headphones on your head.
Cover your head with the hood of the jacket, to hide the fact that you're listening to music.

text: Gather your hoodie and sewing supplies.  Turn the hoodie inside out.  Locate the front pocket.  Cut a tiny hole in the top of the pocket.  Using a needle and thread, secure the edges of the hole with a few stitches.  Turn the hoodie right side out.  Stitch a small strip of Velcro to either side of the edge of the inner pocket. This will keep the iPod from falling out of your pocket. Place the iPod in the pocket.  Slide the wire through the hole, from the inside of your jacket. Plug the wire into the iPod. The headphones should be on the inside of the jacket. Put the jacket on and place the headphones on your head.  Cover your head with the hood of the jacket, to hide the fact that you're listening to music.
